-4fyshbDaSHhKoPPtY6GFA.text: Love this little hidden gem. Amazing mocha!! Cakes are great! However be prepared to wait during the evening. Have yet to try the chocolate and spreads but they also look good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Mocha, salted caramel and dolce ricco cake

MHAjoFspIhPgszsRl6puMg.text: Sooooo dirty and smelly tables Average hot chocolate and mocha Yes it's not expensive Yes the staff so friendly But not worth the wait and money

LAaV3o_X8WC-bGi38z47Jg.text: Said is so, so good. The hot chocolate they prepare is so thick and delicious, with its pure black colour and not so sweet taste. I ordered the smallest cup possible and struggled to finish it still as it was so dense but satisfying at the same time. I haven't tried any of their food options however they have a great variety!

jjqj_j1rx-QhKuJOSPqyTQ.text: Recommend the hazelnut hot chocolate. You don't get much, but it's very sweet and strong that you won't need much.

eSvAjNViUe0CMpXVfvrk9A.text: Its the best hot chocolate in London weather its hazel nut or milk chocolate plus great salted caramel cake

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. The best hot hot chocolate in London and great salted caramel cake

i9ctB4URtmb2Lk0PbKubyg.text: After a cold day in London, hot chocolate never sounded better. My friend and I walked all the way to SoHo to find this little place, only to find that it was packed and so we decided to take away. A little disappointed I couldn't get the cup with chocolate oozing from the sides, but my cup of dark hot chocolate was also great, just imagine a rich and thick cup of hot chocolate. Yee. It is a little pricey - I originally got a small size, but switched the regular because the portions were small, but still definitely worth it.

IGChh9jrRvdvwGbwATDyIg.text: Beautiful hot chocolate. Genuinely gorgeous. Drink it and no other Hot Chocolate will ever do. Especially the Gianduia.Desserts are less gorgeous with obvious over-chilled strawberries and rock solid profiteroles... Atmosphere is a little cramped, but it's still a lovely chocolately adventure.

0s9wrb7k1Z8S7Jc2uyyJCQ.text: This London branch of a Roman chocolatemaker is worth a visit if you're into chocolate. They have bonbons and -- a mark of seriousness in my experience -- a variety of ~70% cacao bars from beans grown in various countries. Service was friendly and efficient the Saturday night I went.

HZMPiTUh02bTtnkvxxnzWw.text: The hot chocolate is a must! Very delicious - especially with cream on the side. Don't drink it in a hurry though, it's especially delicious as the chocolate solidifies.

yjQZmx9QMqAFdJldJnyM-g.text: Went after daughter saw some youtubers speaking highly of the place. Nice idea but long lines/waits and it was ok. If in neighborhood would visit but not taking tube to visit again

Lhb9y1MvzcQ9VDB1hYoSGw.text: The best hot chocolate I've ever had in my life, it's like I'm drinking melted chocolate.Order the milk with the 3 melted chocolate dripping from the side of the cup

CDPeJC2xOvGECAWTYTEyLw.text: Warning. Just EAT and DRINK it before reading.I walked past here from time to time as it is on my way to the gym. Always there were streams of customers. You will notice easily the cup of hot choc/ coffee this shop served is like no others, as the richness of the chocolate oozes out from the cup and beautifully cascades on the side of the cup, making the drink look choco-sexy! That day, I decided to go for this "fatoption". Once inside, it is like a little Rome in London, cozy environment instantly sweeps off your weariness of city life. And I instantly felt lighter. I sat down next to the toasty fireplace, mesmerised by the not-burning-the-makeshift-wood-fireplace, and the shiny metal chocolate moulds adorned on the wall in the shop.I ordered a hot chocolate , medium size, and a strawberry cheesecake. I told you guys I went for the FAT OPTION, didnt i ! lol anyways, somehow, I made my medium chocolate... with triple chocolate... (god knows what that means, I just saw it later on my bill), it was delightful, high quality, thick , but believe it or not, not sickly sweet AT ALL! I was spooning it constantly in my mouth, and alternate it with a mouthful of the creamy strawberry cheesecake. I was over the moon. I thoroughly enjoyed my time at SAID and just wish I have had it before my workout, and not after.This IS the place if you are in need of a sugar fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom

ma7INuXUUA9D1y8yrMmeJw.text: The place was buuuuusy on Saturday afternoon however we only wanted to buy some chocolates. They still made us wait outside in the cold before we could go in to buy them.Once in we were ignored a while and finally got the attention of someone to take us through what the chocolates were as the labels were not visible. We went for 4 chocolates which came to £3.20 - this does sound pricey but we had been to several others through the day and this was actually reasonably priced! We didn't eat in (although I have had a hot chocolate and chocolate tart from here before and can highly recommend - the cakes are quite pricey though). The dark chocolate truffle didn't really have much cocoa flavour, the peanut wafer chocolate was nice but again wasn't powerful enough, the salted caramel was good - rich and salty, and I can't remember the last one we got soooo can't have been all that good? Not a bad chocolate shop but seeing as this is what this place is meant to be all about I wasn't so impressed. I would recommend it more for an eat in cake and drink and head over to Paul A Youngs round the corner for some amazing (but very very expensive) chocolates.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom

c81ASTVom03AUjg5cFVAJQ.text: Heaven. If you are a coffee and chocolate lover, YOU MUST STOP HERE. During our visit, we enjoy the espresso in the chocolate covered cups. It was perfection. I walked out with the chocolate coffee sauce and a few chocolate bites. It's an intimate space that will fill up quickly. Took a while to get out bill and pay (they are always busy) but everyone was nice and helpful. I could easily go here every day.

c3KyQc4SYwiTqAlAVyTb_g.text: As I write this, two days after my visit, I am still thinking about the hot chocolate. I am even considering if it would be too extravagant to plan a trip to the capital solely so I can visit Said again. This review is a little different to my usual reviews.  Usually, I like to build up a scene and give you, the reader, way too much information than you really need. But with this place, I felt I had to start with the main story of this review.  The scene setting can start now.....So, I spent a long weekend with my mum and step-dad.  On my route back up north, I had arranged to meet a friend after he finished work, and because I had bought a cheap ticket from the south coast, I had a few hours to kill in London.  Usually I would find a bar to sit in and have a glass or two of wine.  But since I am trying to cut down on my alcohol consumption, I needed another option.  As my train was approaching London Victoria, my mind wandered back to a conversation I had with a colleague from our London office a couple of months ago about hot chocolate.  More precisely, that our continental cousins seem to do a better job of a proper, chocolate-y hot chocolate than the British milk-y product.  My colleague told me about an Italian place in Soho which was, apparently, divine.It didn't take too much to find out the cafe and where it is.  I know my way around London so I found it fairly easily after my customary window shop around Bond Street.  I think if you're not familiar with Soho, you may find that you need a map, but it is pretty easy to find.When I arrived, it seemed fairly full, but being a loner, I found a spare seat at the end of a table, where the kind couple on the end said I could perch.  I chose the dark hot chocolate. And boy was my colleague correct on their description of this as 'divine'. It not often these words will leave my lips, but I am glad that I'm on am alcohol detox because otherwise I would not have come to this wonderful place.  As I said at the start of this review, I am still thinking of it.  Last night, I even had a dream that I bathed in it. That is pretty bad. To accompany the chocolate, I went for a raspberry cheesecake, as it sounded healthy.  Well, I was wrong, as nothing healthy tastes that good. It was a great accompaniment to the hot chocolate.  It was £8.50 , which to my adopted-Northerner brain, seemed a lot but actually worth it for the pleasure gained. And what is life if you can't have utterly divine pleasure every now and again.They also sell products in their shop and on the shelf next to my table were jars upon jars of a chocolate sauce/spread. I regret not buying some, though if I had, I don't think it would have made it to Manchester. I can pretty much guarantee that I will be back here.  Even if I only have time for a quick visit.  I noticed that they do takeaway, which is great to note.  They also do coffee and tea but I'm not sure why anyone would ever go for anything other than the utterly divine hot chocolate.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Divine hot chocolate and raspberry cheesecake

qbPJhn_ekE_zbhPduFl1-Q.text: Really fun place to hang out. I get the mocha and ask for dark, white and milk drizzled on the rim of my mug. Very pretty and tasty. The coffee and chocolate are exquisite quality. After 5pm the place gets busy so expect to wait ages from then on for a table.

NC8mv7stlOmDiTwqAEgRDA.text: I'd say that you need the coffee to delute and wash down the chocolate :) I was flashed. Definitely a must visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Seriously the heaven of chocolate

oAOG6GQwtOBR0qf6431oAA.text: Amazing Chocolates, the mocha is the best I have ever tasted... the place is cozy and the service is good, but they need more help to cope with the clientele! Fat service will make the lines shorter. A must try place in So

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Mooooocha

j6eqxNrOMzc1yURauCv97w.text: Hi Folks, when you need love eat chocolate they said, and SAID can provide to you all love you need, a very well decorated chocolate bar with one of the most amazing and tasty chocolate ever. White, Dark or Milk chocolate? here you can satisfy your palate and feel loved again after a foggy day in Lnd

8VtiU4jeQa8gyGYTdpMksA.text: The place to go for a rich, thick, yummy hot chocolate in Soho!  Pastries were pretty good, too. Always packed inside a little shop; there's also outside seating but just as crowded. The efficient staff works hard to get you situated. Do not go here with a large group; either alone or with just one friend is ideal and will get you serviced quickly. And, the large hot chocolate is really JUMBO, so unless you're super thirsty and haven't eaten for two days, order a small or medium.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Hot chocolate goodness

1AaEedeGSdb6r2wA8rkoSA.text: All you need is chocolate .. I love this place because of there chocolates .. They have different flavors  of chocolate & cake ... If your one of chocolate lovers you should visit them and the best time is morning because it's always crowded .. I love the way how the cup was served it's really beautiful .. The taste was delicious , staff are really friendly .. Prices are good .., try it you will love it

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom

Sj_r4VM1SU76fwi2DtyhxA.text: I love having coffee breaks there, the place smells nice and chocolatey. Good atmosphere, nice people. Over crowded there might be a wait for tables

cq_dafXctj2AURtKa8RmTg.text: Lovely chocolate selection- I purchased three 24 boxes!! Costumer service were friendly and helpful.The space is very small and can become overwhelming-

ouLhe45rcJ1N_x97478vng.text: Good place.  All kinds of chocolate things for you to try.Found it while looking for the Broad Street Pump (now just a marker on the building next door).  Solid milkshakes; good chocolate cake.  Great people-watching.Very friendly staff.

05bbLQfqo6maNSwGmPx5rg.text: Chocolate shots! Love the salted caramel tart and dark hot chocolate.. This cafe served really good chocolate and coffee. We ordered two cakes, one salted caramel tart and chocolate cake.. one hot dark chocolate and one gianduja chocolate. The cafe ambience is great! Love the wooden decorated furniture and very homely styled cafe. Price is good and service is superb.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate cake and caramel tart
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Carrot n walnut
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Hot chocolate

V-z4CtT1D1MZJp7nnZ5dlQ.text: Slow service, but worth the wait. The place is very small, intimate and has a cosy fireplace. It's not very loud and has an extensive menu for a small cafe.I had the hot chocolate which I would only recommend to extreme chocoholics, but the popular, most ordered option is their mocha.I also ordered the profiteroles for dessert which are a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Said's Hot Chocolate

FEjihRidbP4U5bxvtPfw3g.text: Such a lovely spot to meet up with friends - looks like a great space to work too! My friend had a dark hot chocolate which looked awesome - I decided on the tomato bruschetta (there are other versions, including an intriguing chocolate version, available) which was fresh and delicious.

ob-5YLPtlAhitL_e29J3Fg.text: Got here at 9:30 p.m. And waited about 25 minutes to be seated. We were a party if six, so I don't recommend this place for big groups. The place is tiny and very crowded. Ambiance is cozy and very hipster with silver chocolate molds decorating the walls, and milk tanks as seats. If you love chocolate this is your place. Delicious drinks and decadent desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Espresso, hot chocolate, a scoop of vanilla ice cream, and drizzled with a  chocolate ganache
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino with three different types of chocolate oozing out of the cup - dark, milk chocolate, and white chocolate.

G60u6-wXaUvZZtPdbYWcBw.text: The chocolate is on point and the mocha is ok, not the best mocha I've had but definitely one of the prettiest mochas I've had.The two female waitresses were atrocious, completely ignoring us at one point and uninviting on  arrival. Took 10 mins plus to place our order after a male english waiter saw we were having difficulties placing our order.The caramel cake is a choice worth making and maybe grab one of their hot chocolates as they do that better than their mochas.

WkTuntTp-sxPSa-0YMjHOg.text: Terrible service, rude staff, overpriced and pretentious.Came to this place to try their chocolate. There were some people outside, we approached the door and one of the waitresses blocked our way in and put a cord across the door. Not a single word to explain what was happening or to acknowledge us. We stood there waiting thinking that it might be a few minutes to wait as it seemed quite busy and maybe they needed some time to clear the tables. Tables were cleared and people left and we were still kept waiting outside. We would have left already, but we had already been waiting for a while so we stayed. Finally we were let in and sat down. Waited for the menu and had to call the waitresses twice to ask them to take our orders. Eventually she came over and when we ordered hot chocolate she said they had run out. Seriously? You couldn't say that from the beginning? People come here for the hot chocolate and it doesn't cross your mind to tell that you have no hot chocolate? Funny enough the cups were adorned with chocolate poured down the side, which can only be hot chocolate... But they had run out. Poor managerial skills, poor customer service. Tiny table to fit two slices of cake (huge and tasty but also dry and not fresh) and two teas with their respective teapots.The whole cord blocking the entrance to create expectation is just pathetic and mean, keeping people waiting outside in winter for no reason, just to attract attention.

NVuveQsMxHGTmWrsiQ7RYA.text: I LOVE this place! It is small and some seating areas are a bit awkward. We walked in and it was very crowded, we thought we would have to wait or order for take away, but one of the waiters was able to set up a table for us right by the window. The service is very quick. We ordered a blended coffee which was really just an expresso shaken with ice, a piece of carrot cake and a small hot chocolate. GET THE HOT CHOCOLATE! It was rim covered by white, milk and dark chocolate. If you've ever had hot chocolate in Italy then you may have a flashback! I've had hot chocolate very similar but never spot on like in Italy.... until now!! They have a TON of chocolates, if you're a chocolate lover then this is a must. I personally didn't care too much for the carrot cake, the filling was delicious but the cake part was not that great. The "blended" coffee was nothing special but very good if you like expresso, which I do. Not great for parties larger than 5, cute for a first date, dates, girl time, or small group meetups.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom

-LNyo5NQyuW4CGv79uURHA.text: I have been here many many times, but not for a while...the staff have changed of course and they have removed the big table at the end...shame, but I guess they wanted to use the space betterA double espresso and the chocolate cake...well you have to don't you...nothing changed thereStill had the same wifi as last time...(its a great place to work - and eat!)Always a pleasure here

F4MNogRzWxXh-bFBOtVPbA.text: First off, Said WAS NOT the hot chocolate I was expecting. I was expecting chocolate with hot milk.. but instead I found out that it was literally chocolate melted into a cup. Personally, this was not for me.. it was really sweet.. and just so heavy and I couldn't finish it at all. For the cost of this about 5 pounds for a medium cup I would not get it again.. but this is just an FYI for all my Americans out there that might be expecting what I expected as well. The service here was great, the ambiance of it was amazing (European street-like), and they have a variety of pastries, coffee, and food as well. Just wasn't my cup of chocolate.

COfSMDv9z1h5kvEWVpuIrg.text: Holy chocolate heaven! My friend had read a ton of reviews and we had to stop in. It was about a 20 minute wait, but we didn't have a bad thing to say. My hot chocolate came and was dripping off the cup. 3 different kinds of chocolate coated the  cup and made each sip more indulgent than the last. It was like drinking warm chocolate pudding...getting a hug from the inside. It was astounding! Definitely stop in if you're looking to have the most decadent experience of your life!

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom

FFDbNzlX2KfOZ24Y0gBfsA.text: As good as hot chocolate gets. I had this thick, almost pudding-like Italian style hot chocolate years ago in Italy and had never really stumbled upon it again until reading about Said! I am so glad we went out of our way to visit on our recent trip to London - it's worth every minute of the wait and every penny of the cost. This will now be a staple spot to visit any time I happen to be remotely near London, or when I make it back to Rome! Said is legit!

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Large milk hot chocolate with triple chocolate in the cup!
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate mousse, chocolate eclair, whipped cream.
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Chocolates!

bz0p_-kgAhoJ3mSWFqQ3og.text: If you like chocolate, you will love Said!!  This place is chocolate heaven.  White chocolate, milk chocolate and dark chocolate.... what do you prefer?  They have it.  Their hot chocolate is your choice of chocolate in a cup with all three chocolates poured on the rim of the cup!  So, if you don't like THAT much chocolate I would get a cookie or strawberry dipped in chocolate.  The hot chocolates were good since it was cold outside, it was literally like drinking melted chocolate.  You can even order those in a chocolate cup of your choice!!   They also have chocolate you can purchase and other cookies and cakes and stuff!  The place is in London, but it is Italian chocolate from Italy.  All the workers were Italian and the name stands for Soc. Az. Industria  Dolciumi.  It was established in 1923.  They were very helpful and friendly.  So if you find yourself in London and the Soho district and want to get chocolate wasted, give this place a look, you will not be disappointed!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Medium hot chocolate with milk chocolate that has dark chocolate and white chocolate on the sides
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Small hot chocolate  (dark) with milk chocolate and white chocolate on the sides
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Inside wall of chocolate for sale in jars

-dueHKmoRfCGwly04n-Syg.text: Any chocolate lover must make a stop at Said in soho. It's Italian hot chocolate (basically like you're drinking melted chocolate)  is the most decadent I have ever had. We tried the dark and milk hot chocolate with white, milk, and dark chocolate poured over the rim of the cup (cost an extra £1) and it's so sweet it's difficult to finish a "regular". Whip is most definitely not necessary, the drink is so sweet that we did not even touch it Come here prepared for dessert, if you're looking for a hot chocolate place to warm you up on a cold day, this probably isn't the type of place you're looking for.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. the most decadent Italian hot chocolate with white, dark, and milk chocolate poured over the rim
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. small milk chocolate & two regular dark chocolates

4ZAYIJ0YccNdjF3WGLREiA.text: Having been to Belgium and Switzerland, I was in search of good hot chocolate in London. This is a very small cafe with not a lot of seating, but the tables turn over rather quickly and it is definitely worth the wait. I recommend getting the dark hot chocolate with the three chocolate rim if you are a true lover of chocolate.  If you like chocolate but aren't a dedicated lover, get the milk chocolate with a three chocolate rim. My sister greatly enjoyed the Gianduia hot chocolate (basically milk chocolate with hazelnut). DO NOT GET LARGER THAN A REGULAR SIZE! This hot chocolate is very, very rich so the regular is more than enough, I would even recommend just getting the small. The three chocolate rim to the hot chocolate cup is a must and is both delicious and beautiful My friends and family always enjoy a visit here.

ThXkqKajgD7hwcbA8P7WYw.text: This Italian chocolate is in the SoHo district is known for its chocolate but the hot chocolate is hands down the best I've ever tasted.  It's like chocolate melted, slight thick but oh so decadent.  I always seek it out when I'm in town.  Lines are long for a table, so just ask for it to "take away."

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom

dRpGK0GANtlUDBsIxIRxtQ.text: Maybe it's a local thing, but drinking liquid chocolate from a cup was literally nauseating for us. One sip was delicious, two was too much, three was a definite mistake, and the fourth had us longing to get it up by any means necessary. Even the chocolate croissant, a simple and delicious pastry elsewhere, was covered in chocolate so that it over flowed the plate, making it sickeningly sweet and inedible after a bite or two. I get the novelty of it, but I don't understand why this place has return customers. The real problem was the manager/owner. She was rude to us, getting angry when we didn't understand what she was saying and we watched her yell at customers, forcing them to move tables after they had already settled. The shop was half empty so I can only assume she was saving the better table for someone else? She was abusive to the one server too, scolding him for inexplicable reasons and gesturing angrily from across the room. It was awkward and unpleasant to be around, especially as we tried to eek out our money's worth from pastry and drinks that none of us enjoyed. Happy to never return to this place!

YU-VroQw1xJe3lGWToIdfA.text: Overrated place. Desserts are below average. Staff attitude is horrible, and AC is not working during London's summer time these days.

9KXFxThNe9wpflIqMjvxyg.text: Had to come here to try the hot drinks, particularly the triple chocolate cocoa. Small is £2.50, with whip it's another 50p, and the chocolate layer, I believe is an additional £1, for an eat-in price of £4.80--not sure the sipping chocolate is worth that much, but it's definitely fun to see it served up so festive. Great for a dessert, it's so thick you have to eat it with a spoon and so rich it could even be shared with another person.The interior of the place is adorable, has a rustic feel with chocolate molds lining the side of the wall, confections like malt balls and chocolate covered almonds in large glass jars in the window, and a countertop decorated with cakes, brownies, and their handmade chocolates for sale at varying prices. Some they sell individually, others are purchased in increments of 100g. A great place to have a business meeting, a light lunch (there are sammies), an afternoon coffee, or an evening sweet treat. They are open late, which is convenient for those late night chocolate cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom

27U7WNg0ABBHGLwUOYQ98g.text: Oh my goodness chocolate heaven! We had a bit of a wait to get in and sadly they couldn't even sit us all in the same table (party of 4) but we split up and made the best of that. This was some of the best chocolate I have ever had! What an indulgence. The shop was adorable, but tiny. The chocolate though! Did I mention the chocolate? Superb!

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom

lfFI_Uvp107TodP_92tt6g.text: I love this place. Got the martini coffee it wasn't great but I enjoyed the dessert and the coffee shoot . I love the melted hot chocolate in everything the ambiance the white chocolate .

JTLk1STR_3J_PdkU1lTCXA.text: EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!!!!!! THIS PLACE IS SO CUTE!!!!!I met a friend here once and I immediately got giddy when I walked in. I came here on a weekday, maybe around 11, so it wasn't busy at all. There were multiple seating options and I sat at the end of a long table with a comfy bar seat. We ordered the hot chocolate and it was my first time to have hot chocolate like this! Thick! Creamy! Delicious! Beautiful! And the whipped cream came in a separate baby glass. Heheheh. Too cute.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Get the hot chocolate! It's thick and creamy and amazing
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. With whipped cream...
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Hot chocolate!!!!!

QZGIx3p9qJR-6yom2uvwgg.text: It was freezing yesterday and I thought a nice cup of hit chocolate would be perfect, so we tried Said. The hot chocolate was more like chocolate cake batter or brownie batter in that IT WAS SO THICK! I read a previous review that mentioned that you need a spoon to drink it and I thought they were exaggerating until I tried it myself and that's a very accurate statement! Too thick and too rich, I could only take a couple of sips before throwing it away.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom

am4nO1FoKRRe3sqJ9LpmzQ.text: There was a huge queue.  There signature coffee is out of this world.  Their desserts are really fresh and worth trying...from a coffee and chocolate dessert fanatic!

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom

dmjYluoIBFNBfI8jbo9ZTA.text: The most amazing chocolate shop! We stopped in for desert and got the beignet and the donut drizzled with hot chocolate. They were not too sweet and clearly high quality chocolate. We will come back to try the hot chocolate on its own!

mO_Y5xbTk7l2o2cGFvTnnA.text: You may think you died and went to heaven for a tasting at Said. A break from breakfast in a chocolate shop (Italian) brought samples of dark chocolate, some with salt, some with hazelnut. Next  taste was a chocolate similar to Nutella but 100 times tastier. Yum! And finally a hot chocolate like I've never tasted. Once we finished our tour we back tracked to purchase chocolate to bring home.

y99SQ71FOkJZ3HHqa2rNyQ.text: Sort of a bit of Heaven on Earth. I should say so myself.Said...inside Said some of the purest richest Chocolate lives. It is like no other coco bean I've ever tasted. It's pure. Not all sugared up. Unadulterated.  A virgin chocolate waiting to be consumed by loving hands.I've had the hot chocolate twice. While I am a coffee drinker, I do recommend the hot chocolate as a must try. It's dreamy. It was great.Everything was yummi.I love you Said.

photos.caption: Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Yummi in my tummi. One sip and jet lag bye bye
Photo of Said - London, United Kingdom. Death by Yummilishous
